Package edu.cornell.gdiac.json

Class GameCanvas

java.lang.Object
edu.cornell.gdiac.json.GameCanvas
public class GameCanvas extends Object
Primary view class for the game, abstracting the basic graphics calls.

This version of GameCanvas only supports both rectangular and polygonal Sprite drawing. It also supports a debug mode that draws polygonal outlines. However, that mode must be done in a separate begin/end pass.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameCanvas

      public GameCanvas()
      Creates a new GameCanvas determined by the application configuration.

      Width, height, and fullscreen are taken from the LWGJApplicationConfig object used to start the application. This constructor initializes all of the necessary graphics objects.

  • Method Details

    • dispose

      public void dispose()
      Eliminate any resources that should be garbage collected manually.

    • getWidth

      public int getWidth()
      Returns the width of this canvas

      This currently gets its value from Gdx.graphics.getWidth()

      Returns:
      the width of this canvas

    • setWidth

      public void setWidth(int width)
      Changes the width of this canvas

      This method raises an IllegalStateException if called while drawing is active (e.g. in-between a begin-end pair).

      Parameters:
      width - the canvas width

    • getHeight

      public int getHeight()
      Returns the height of this canvas

      This currently gets its value from Gdx.graphics.getHeight()

      Returns:
      the height of this canvas

    • setSize

      public void setSize(int width, int height)
      Changes the width and height of this canvas

      This method raises an IllegalStateException if called while drawing is active (e.g. in-between a begin-end pair).

      Parameters:
      width - the canvas width
      height - the canvas height

    • isFullscreen

      public boolean isFullscreen()
      Returns whether this canvas is currently fullscreen.
      Returns:
      whether this canvas is currently fullscreen.

    • setFullscreen

      public void setFullscreen(boolean value, boolean desktop)
      Sets whether or not this canvas should change to fullscreen.

      If desktop is true, it will use the current desktop resolution for fullscreen, and not the width and height set in the configuration object at the start of the application. This parameter has no effect if fullscreen is false.

      This method raises an IllegalStateException if called while drawing is active (e.g. in-between a begin-end pair).

      Parameters:
      fullscreen - Whether this canvas should change to fullscreen.
      desktop - Whether to use the current desktop resolution

    • resize

      public void resize()
      Resets the SpriteBatch camera when this canvas is resized.

      If you do not call this when the window is resized, you will get weird scaling issues.

    • getBlendState

      public GameCanvas.BlendState getBlendState()
      Returns the current color blending state for this canvas.

      Textures draw to this canvas will be composited according to the rules of this blend state.

      Returns:
      the current color blending state for this canvas

    • setBlendState

      public void setBlendState(GameCanvas.BlendState state)
      Sets the color blending state for this canvas.

      Any texture draw subsequent to this call will use the rules of this blend state to composite with other textures. Unlike the other setters, if it is perfectly safe to use this setter while drawing is active (e.g. in-between a begin-end pair).

      Parameters:
      state - the color blending rule

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clear the screen so we can start a new animation frame

    • begin

      public void begin(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Affine2 affine)
      Start a standard drawing sequence.

      Nothing is flushed to the graphics card until the method end() is called.

      Parameters:
      affine - the global transform apply to the camera

    • begin

      public void begin(float sx, float sy)
      Start a standard drawing sequence.

      Nothing is flushed to the graphics card until the method end() is called.

      Parameters:
      sx - the amount to scale the x-axis
      sy - the amount to scale the y-axis

    • begin

      public void begin()
      Start a standard drawing sequence.

      Nothing is flushed to the graphics card until the method end() is called.

    • end

      public void end()
      Ends a drawing sequence, flushing textures to the graphics card.

    • draw

      public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture image, float x, float y)
      Draws the tinted texture at the given position.

      The texture colors will be multiplied by the given color. This will turn any white into the given color. Other colors will be similarly affected.

      Unless otherwise transformed by the global transform (@see begin(Affine2)), the texture will be unscaled. The bottom left of the texture will be positioned at the given coordinates.

      Parameters:
      image - The texture to draw
      tint - The color tint
      x - The x-coordinate of the bottom left corner
      y - The y-coordinate of the bottom left corner

    • draw

      public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture image, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color tint, float x, float y, float width, float height)
      Draws the tinted texture at the given position.

      The texture colors will be multiplied by the given color. This will turn any white into the given color. Other colors will be similarly affected.

      Unless otherwise transformed by the global transform (@see begin(Affine2)), the texture will be unscaled. The bottom left of the texture will be positioned at the given coordinates.

      Parameters:
      image - The texture to draw
      tint - The color tint
      x - The x-coordinate of the bottom left corner
      y - The y-coordinate of the bottom left corner
      width - The texture width
      height - The texture height

    • draw

      public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture image, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color tint, float ox, float oy, float x, float y, float width, float height)
      Draws the tinted texture at the given position.

      The texture colors will be multiplied by the given color. This will turn any white into the given color. Other colors will be similarly affected.

      Unless otherwise transformed by the global transform (@see begin(Affine2)), the texture will be unscaled. The bottom left of the texture will be positioned at the given coordinates.

      Parameters:
      image - The texture to draw
      tint - The color tint
      ox - The x-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
      oy - The y-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
      x - The x-coordinate of the texture origin (on screen)
      y - The y-coordinate of the texture origin (on screen)
      width - The texture width
      height - The texture height

    • draw

      public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture image, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color tint, float ox, float oy, float x, float y, float angle, float sx, float sy)
      Draws the tinted texture with the given transformations

      The texture colors will be multiplied by the given color. This will turn any white into the given color. Other colors will be similarly affected.

      The transformations are BEFORE after the global transform (@see begin(Affine2)). As a result, the specified texture origin will be applied to all transforms (both the local and global).

      The local transformations in this method are applied in the following order: scaling, then rotation, then translation (e.g. placement at (sx,sy)).

      Parameters:
      image - The texture to draw
      tint - The color tint
      ox - The x-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
      oy - The y-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
      x - The x-coordinate of the texture origin (on screen)
      y - The y-coordinate of the texture origin (on screen)
      angle - The rotation angle (in degrees) about the origin.
      sx - The x-axis scaling factor
      sy - The y-axis scaling factor

    • draw

      public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture image, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color tint, float ox, float oy, com.badlogic.gdx.math.Affine2 transform)
      Draws the tinted texture with the given transformations

      The texture colors will be multiplied by the given color. This will turn any white into the given color. Other colors will be similarly affected.

      The transformations are BEFORE after the global transform (@see begin(Affine2)). As a result, the specified texture origin will be applied to all transforms (both the local and global).

      The local transformations in this method are applied in the following order: scaling, then rotation, then translation (e.g. placement at (sx,sy)).

      Parameters:
      image - The texture to draw
      tint - The color tint
      ox - The x-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
      oy - The y-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
      transform - The image transform

    • draw

      public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion region, float x, float y)
      Draws the tinted texture region (filmstrip) at the given position.

      A texture region is a single texture file that can hold one or more textures. It is used for filmstrip animation.

      The texture colors will be multiplied by the given color. This will turn any white into the given color. Other colors will be similarly affected.

      Unless otherwise transformed by the global transform (@see begin(Affine2)), the texture will be unscaled. The bottom left of the texture will be positioned at the given coordinates.

      Parameters:
      region - The texture to draw
      tint - The color tint
      x - The x-coordinate of the bottom left corner
      y - The y-coordinate of the bottom left corner

    • draw

      public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion region, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color tint, float x, float y, float width, float height)
      Draws the tinted texture at the given position.

      The texture colors will be multiplied by the given color. This will turn any white into the given color. Other colors will be similarly affected.

      Unless otherwise transformed by the global transform (@see begin(Affine2)), the texture will be unscaled. The bottom left of the texture will be positioned at the given coordinates. region

      Parameters:
      image - The texture to draw
      tint - The color tint
      x - The x-coordinate of the bottom left corner
      y - The y-coordinate of the bottom left corner
      width - The texture width
      height - The texture height

      public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion region, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color tint, float ox, float oy, float x, float y, float width, float height)
      Draws the tinted texture at the given position.

    • draw

      public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion region, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color tint, float ox, float oy, float x, float y, float angle, float sx, float sy)
      Draws the tinted texture region (filmstrip) with the given transformations

      A texture region is a single texture file that can hold one or more textures. It is used for filmstrip animation.

      The texture colors will be multiplied by the given color. This will turn any white into the given color. Other colors will be similarly affected.

      The transformations are BEFORE after the global transform (@see begin(Affine2)). As a result, the specified texture origin will be applied to all transforms (both the local and global).

      The local transformations in this method are applied in the following order: scaling, then rotation, then translation (e.g. placement at (sx,sy)).

      Parameters:
      region - The texture to draw
      tint - The color tint
      ox - The x-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
      oy - The y-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
      x - The x-coordinate of the texture origin (on screen)
      y - The y-coordinate of the texture origin (on screen)
      angle - The rotation angle (in degrees) about the origin.
      sx - The x-axis scaling factor
      sy - The y-axis scaling factor

    • draw

      public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion region, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color tint, float ox, float oy, com.badlogic.gdx.math.Affine2 affine)
      Draws the tinted texture with the given transformations

      The texture colors will be multiplied by the given color. This will turn any white into the given color. Other colors will be similarly affected.

      The transformations are BEFORE after the global transform (@see begin(Affine2)). As a result, the specified texture origin will be applied to all transforms (both the local and global).

      The local transformations in this method are applied in the following order: scaling, then rotation, then translation (e.g. placement at (sx,sy)).

      Parameters:
      image - The region to draw
      tint - The color tint
      ox - The x-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
      oy - The y-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
      transform - The image transform

    • draw

      public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.PolygonRegion region, float x, float y)
      Draws the polygonal region with the given transformations

      A polygon region is a texture region with attached vertices so that it draws a textured polygon. The polygon vertices are relative to the texture file.

      The texture colors will be multiplied by the given color. This will turn any white into the given color. Other colors will be similarly affected.

      The transformations are BEFORE after the global transform (@see begin(Affine2)). As a result, the specified texture origin will be applied to all transforms (both the local and global).

      The local transformations in this method are applied in the following order: scaling, then rotation, then translation (e.g. placement at (sx,sy)).

      Parameters:
      region - The polygon to draw
      tint - The color tint
      x - The x-coordinate of the bottom left corner
      y - The y-coordinate of the bottom left corner

    • draw

      public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.PolygonRegion region, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color tint, float x, float y, float width, float height)
      Draws the polygonal region with the given transformations

      A polygon region is a texture region with attached vertices so that it draws a textured polygon. The polygon vertices are relative to the texture file.

      The texture colors will be multiplied by the given color. This will turn any white into the given color. Other colors will be similarly affected.

      The transformations are BEFORE after the global transform (@see begin(Affine2)). As a result, the specified texture origin will be applied to all transforms (both the local and global).

      The local transformations in this method are applied in the following order: scaling, then rotation, then translation (e.g. placement at (sx,sy)).

      Parameters:
      region - The polygon to draw
      tint - The color tint
      x - The x-coordinate of the bottom left corner
      y - The y-coordinate of the bottom left corner
      width - The texture width
      height - The texture height

    • draw

      public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.PolygonRegion region, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color tint, float ox, float oy, float x, float y, float width, float height)
      Draws the polygonal region with the given transformations

      A polygon region is a texture region with attached vertices so that it draws a textured polygon. The polygon vertices are relative to the texture file.

      The texture colors will be multiplied by the given color. This will turn any white into the given color. Other colors will be similarly affected.

      The transformations are BEFORE after the global transform (@see begin(Affine2)). As a result, the specified texture origin will be applied to all transforms (both the local and global).

      The local transformations in this method are applied in the following order: scaling, then rotation, then translation (e.g. placement at (sx,sy)).

      Parameters:
      region - The polygon to draw
      tint - The color tint
      ox - The x-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
      oy - The y-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
      x - The x-coordinate of the texture origin (on screen)
      y - The y-coordinate of the texture origin (on screen)
      width - The texture width
      height - The texture height

    • draw

      public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.PolygonRegion region, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color tint, float ox, float oy, float x, float y, float angle, float sx, float sy)
      Draws the polygonal region with the given transformations

      A polygon region is a texture region with attached vertices so that it draws a textured polygon. The polygon vertices are relative to the texture file.

      The texture colors will be multiplied by the given color. This will turn any white into the given color. Other colors will be similarly affected.

      The transformations are BEFORE after the global transform (@see begin(Affine2)). As a result, the specified texture origin will be applied to all transforms (both the local and global).

      The local transformations in this method are applied in the following order: scaling, then rotation, then translation (e.g. placement at (sx,sy)).

      Parameters:
      region - The polygon to draw
      tint - The color tint
      ox - The x-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
      oy - The y-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
      x - The x-coordinate of the texture origin (on screen)
      y - The y-coordinate of the texture origin (on screen)
      angle - The rotation angle (in degrees) about the origin.
      sx - The x-axis scaling factor
      sy - The y-axis scaling factor

    • draw

      public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.PolygonRegion region, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color tint, float ox, float oy, com.badlogic.gdx.math.Affine2 affine)
      Draws the polygonal region with the given transformations

      A polygon region is a texture region with attached vertices so that it draws a textured polygon. The polygon vertices are relative to the texture file.

      The texture colors will be multiplied by the given color. This will turn any white into the given color. Other colors will be similarly affected.

      The transformations are BEFORE after the global transform (@see begin(Affine2)). As a result, the specified texture origin will be applied to all transforms (both the local and global).

      The local transformations in this method are applied in the following order: scaling, then rotation, then translation (e.g. placement at (sx,sy)).

      Parameters:
      region - The polygon to draw
      tint - The color tint
      ox - The x-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
      oy - The y-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
      transform - The image transform

      Parameters:
      affine - the global transform apply to the camera

    • drawPhysics

      public void drawPhysics(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.CircleShape shape, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color color, float x, float y)
      Draws the outline of the given shape in the specified color

      The position of the circle is ignored. Only the radius is used. To move the circle, change the x and y parameters.

      y - The y-coordinate of the shape position

    • drawFOV
